solution_line_template: For the first year, Thomas received {weeks_per_year} x {weekly_allowance_year1} = $<<{weeks_per_year}*{weekly_allowance_year1}={allowance_year1_total}>>{allowance_year1_total}
In the second year, Thomas earned {hourly_wage} x {hours_per_week} = $<<{hourly_wage}*{hours_per_week}={earned_per_week_year2}>>{earned_per_week_year2} a week
In a year, Thomas earned {weeks_per_year} x {earned_per_week_year2} = $<<{weeks_per_year}*{earned_per_week_year2}={earned_year2_total}>>{earned_year2_total}
The total for the two years is {earned_year2_total}+{allowance_year1_total} = <<{earned_year2_total}+{allowance_year1_total}={total_earned_two_years}>>{total_earned_two_years}

In {num_years} years, Thomas' weekly expenses amounted to ${weekly_expenses} x ({weeks_per_year} x {num_years}) = ${weekly_expenses} x {total_weeks_two_years} = $<<{weekly_expenses}*{weeks_per_year}*{num_years}={total_expenses_two_years}>>{total_expenses_two_years}
By the end of {num_years} years, Thomas would have saved ${total_earned_two_years} - ${total_expenses_two_years}= <<{total_earned_two_years}-{total_expenses_two_years}={total_saved}>>{total_saved}
